      • create

        public static Customer create(java.util.Map map)
                       throws ApiCommunicationException,
                              AuthenticationException,
                              InvalidRequestException,
                              NotAllowedException,
                              SystemException
        Creates an Customer object using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively.
        Parameters:
        map - a map of parameters, valid keys and types:
        payments.command.api.APICustomerCardCommand card
        Credit or debit card being used to apply the payment to.
        java.lang.String card.addressCity
        City of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressCountry
        Country code (ISO-3166-1-alpha-2 code) of residence of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine1
        Address of the cardholder required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine2
        Address of the cardholder if needed. required
        java.lang.String card.addressState
        State of residence of the cardholder. State abbreviations should be used. required
        java.lang.String card.addressZip
        Postal code of the cardholder. The postal code size is between 5 and 9 in length and only contain numbers or letters. required
        java.lang.String card.cvc
        CVC security code of the card. This is the code on the back of the card. Example: 123 required
        java.lang.Integer card.expMonth
        Expiration month of the card. Format is MM. Example: January = 01 required
        java.lang.Integer card.expYear
        Expiration year of the card. Format is YY. Example: 2013 = 13 required
        java.lang.String card.id
        ID of card. Unused during customer create.
        java.lang.String card.name
        Name as appears on the card. required
        java.lang.String card.number
        Card number as it appears on the card. [max length: 19, min length: 13]
        java.lang.String email
        Email address of the customer required
        java.lang.String name
        Customer name [max length: 50, min length: 2] required
        java.lang.String reference
        Reference field for external applications use.
        payments.command.api.APISubscriptionCreateCommand subscriptions
        Subscriptions for the customer
        java.lang.Long subscriptions.amount
        Amount of payment in the smallest unit of your currency. Example: 100 = $1.00
        java.lang.String subscriptions.billingCycle
        How the plan is billed to the customer. Values must be AUTO (indefinitely until the customer cancels) or FIXED (a fixed number of billing cycles). [default: AUTO]
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.billingCycleLimit
        The number of fixed billing cycles for a plan. Only used if the billingCycle parameter is set to FIXED. Example: 4
        java.lang.String subscriptions.coupon
        Coupon associated with the subscription for the customer.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.currency
        Currency code (ISO-4217). Must match the currency associated with your account.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.customer
        The customer ID to create the subscription for. Do not supply this when creating a customer.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.frequency
        Frequency of payment for the plan. Used in conjunction with frequencyPeriod. Valid values are "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "MONTHLY" and "YEARLY".
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.frequencyPeriod
        Period of frequency of payment for the plan. Example: if the frequency is weekly, and periodFrequency is 2, then the subscription is billed bi-weekly.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.name
        Name describing subscription
        java.lang.String subscriptions.plan
        The plan ID that the subscription should be created from.
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.quantity
        Quantity of the plan for the subscription. [min value: 1]
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.renewalReminderLeadDays
        If set, how many days before the next billing cycle that a renewal reminder is sent to the customer. If null, then no emails are sent. Minimum value is 7 if set.
        java.lang.String token
        If specified, card associated with card token will be used
        Returns:
        a Customer object.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException

        @Deprecated
public static Customer create(java.lang.String publicKey,
                         java.lang.String privateKey,
                         java.util.Map map)
                       throws ApiCommunicationException,
                              AuthenticationException,
                              InvalidRequestException,
                              NotAllowedException,
                              SystemException
        Deprecated. As of release 1.1, replaced by create(Authentication, Map)
        Creates an Customer object
        Parameters:
        publicKey - Public API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY will be used
        privateKey - Private API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY will be used
        map - a map of parameters, valid keys and types:
        payments.command.api.APICustomerCardCommand card
        Credit or debit card being used to apply the payment to.
        java.lang.String card.addressCity
        City of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressCountry
        Country code (ISO-3166-1-alpha-2 code) of residence of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine1
        Address of the cardholder required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine2
        Address of the cardholder if needed. required
        java.lang.String card.addressState
        State of residence of the cardholder. State abbreviations should be used. required
        java.lang.String card.addressZip
        Postal code of the cardholder. The postal code size is between 5 and 9 in length and only contain numbers or letters. required
        java.lang.String card.cvc
        CVC security code of the card. This is the code on the back of the card. Example: 123 required
        java.lang.Integer card.expMonth
        Expiration month of the card. Format is MM. Example: January = 01 required
        java.lang.Integer card.expYear
        Expiration year of the card. Format is YY. Example: 2013 = 13 required
        java.lang.String card.id
        ID of card. Unused during customer create.
        java.lang.String card.name
        Name as appears on the card. required
        java.lang.String card.number
        Card number as it appears on the card. [max length: 19, min length: 13]
        java.lang.String email
        Email address of the customer required
        java.lang.String name
        Customer name [max length: 50, min length: 2] required
        java.lang.String reference
        Reference field for external applications use.
        payments.command.api.APISubscriptionCreateCommand subscriptions
        Subscriptions for the customer
        java.lang.Long subscriptions.amount
        Amount of payment in the smallest unit of your currency. Example: 100 = $1.00
        java.lang.String subscriptions.billingCycle
        How the plan is billed to the customer. Values must be AUTO (indefinitely until the customer cancels) or FIXED (a fixed number of billing cycles). [default: AUTO]
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.billingCycleLimit
        The number of fixed billing cycles for a plan. Only used if the billingCycle parameter is set to FIXED. Example: 4
        java.lang.String subscriptions.coupon
        Coupon associated with the subscription for the customer.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.currency
        Currency code (ISO-4217). Must match the currency associated with your account.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.customer
        The customer ID to create the subscription for. Do not supply this when creating a customer.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.frequency
        Frequency of payment for the plan. Used in conjunction with frequencyPeriod. Valid values are "DAILY", "WEEKLY", "MONTHLY" and "YEARLY".
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.frequencyPeriod
        Period of frequency of payment for the plan. Example: if the frequency is weekly, and periodFrequency is 2, then the subscription is billed bi-weekly.
        java.lang.String subscriptions.name
        Name describing subscription
        java.lang.String subscriptions.plan
        The plan ID that the subscription should be created from.
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.quantity
        Quantity of the plan for the subscription. [min value: 1]
        java.lang.Integer subscriptions.renewalReminderLeadDays
        If set, how many days before the next billing cycle that a renewal reminder is sent to the customer. If null, then no emails are sent. Minimum value is 7 if set.
        java.lang.String token
        If specified, card associated with card token will be used
        Returns:
        a Customer object.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException

      • create

        public static Customer create(Authentication auth,
              java.util.Map map)
                       throws ApiCommunicationException,
                              AuthenticationException,
                              InvalidRequestException,
                              NotAllowedException,
                              SystemException
        Creates an Customer object
        Parameters:
        auth - Authentication object representing overrides for PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY and PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and/or passing an access token in for operations using OAuth.
        privateKey - Private API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY will be used
        map - a map of parameters, valid keys and types:
        payments.command.api.APICustomerCardCommand card
        Credit or debit card being used to apply the payment to.
        java.lang.String card.addressCity
        City of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressCountry
        Country code (ISO-3166-1-alpha-2 code) of residence of the cardholder. required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine1
        Address of the cardholder required
        java.lang.String card.addressLine2
        Address of the cardholder if needed. required
        java.lang.String card.addressState
        State of residence of the cardholder. State abbreviations should be used. required

        Postal code of the cardholder. The postal code size is between 5 and 9 in length and only contain numbers or letters. required

        ID of card. Unused during customer create.

                                          InvalidRequestException,
                                          NotAllowedException,

        Retrieve Customer objects using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively and the default criteria (max 20, offset 0, default sorting and no filtering).
        Returns:
        a ResourceList object which holds the list of Customer objects and the total number of Customer objects available.

        ApiCommunicationException

        InvalidRequestException

      • list

        public static ResourceList<Customer> list(java.util.Map criteria)
                                   throws ApiCommunicationException,
                                          AuthenticationException,
                                          InvalidRequestException,
                                          NotAllowedException,
                                          SystemException
        Retrieve Customer objects using the specified criteria and using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively.
        Parameters:
        criteria - a map of parameters; valid keys and types are:
        java.util.Map filter
        filter.idFilter by the customer Id
        filter.textCan use this to filter by the name, email or reference for the customer
        filter.dateCreatedMin*Filter by the minimum created date you are searching for - Date in UTC millis
        filter.dateCreatedMax*Filter by the maximum created date you are searching for - Date in UTC millis

        *Use dateCreatedMin with dateCreatedMax in the same filter if you want to search between two created dates
        java.lang.Integer max
        Allows up to a max of 50 list items to return. [min value: 0, max value: 50, default: 20]
        java.lang.Integer offset
        Used in paging of the list. This is the start offset of the page. [min value: 0, default: 0]
        java.util.Map sorting
        Allows for ascending or descending sorting of the list. The value maps properties to the sort direction (either asc for ascending or desc for descending). Sortable properties are: dateCreated id name email reference .
        Returns:
        a ResourceList object which holds the list of Customer objects and the total number of Customer objects available.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException
        See Also:
        ResourceList

      • update

        public Customer update()
                throws ApiCommunicationException,
                       AuthenticationException,
                       InvalidRequestException,
                       ObjectNotFoundException,
                       NotAllowedException,
                       SystemException
        Updates an Customer object. The properties that can be updated:
        • card
        • addressCity (required)
        • addressCountry (required)
        • addressLine1 (required)
        • addressLine2 (required)
        • addressState (required)
        • addressZip (required)
        • cvc (required)
        • expMonth (required)
        • expYear (required)
        • id
        • name (required)
        • number
        • email (required)
        • name (required)
        • reference
        • token
        Returns:
        a Customer object.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        ObjectNotFoundException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException
